intro: Malveopsis fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered malveopsis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dry seeds. Malveopsis fasciculata is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
